prompt:
Answer this question.

		Question: where did the anasazi indians live
		Answer:
answer:
Sure, here is the answer to the question:


The Anasazi indians lived in the Colorado Plateau. 

The Anasazi indians were part of the Pueblo peoples and were ancestral to the Hopi people. They lived in Chaco Canyon, the Four Corners region, Canyon del Mogollon, Sinagua Ceremonial Complex, Pueblo Bonito, Inscription House Ruin, Toadlena Ruin, Pueblo de Cochiti, Galisteo Pueblo, Hawikowe, and Painted Rock Ruin.
kaping_triples: (In Search of the Old Ones: Exploring the Anasazi World of the Southwest, author, David Roberts), (Tanoans, part of, Pueblo peoples), (Ancestral Puebloans, has part, Hopi people), (Hopi people, part of, Ancestral Puebloans), (Ancestral Puebloans, location of formation, sipapu), (Pueblo Bonito, studied by, Archaeologists), (Hopi, part of, Pueblo peoples), (Navajo people, different from, Pueblo peoples), (Ancestral Puebloans, location of formation, Colorado Plateau), (Pueblo peoples, different from, Navajo people)
